tit.e: Higashidonozuka Tumulus (a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)
Higashidonozuka-kofun Tumulus (a large keyhole-shaped mound in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)
tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
tit.e: Higashidonozuka-kofun Tumulus (a large keyhole-shaped mound in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 東殿塚古墳（ひがしどのづかこふん）は、奈良県天理市に所在する。
sen.e: Higashidonozuka Tumulus is located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Higashidonozuka-kofun Tumulus is located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Higashidonozuka-kofun Tumulus is located in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: It is a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound constructed in the early Kofun period (tumulus period).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a large keyhole-shaped mound constructed in the early Kofun period (tumulus period).
It is a large keyhole-shaped mound constructed in the early Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: 本古墳は、出土した埴輪から4世紀初め頃の築造と推定される。
sen.e: This tumulus is estimated from the excavated Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs [kofun]) to have been constructed approximately at the beginning of the fourth century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This tumulus is estimated from the excavated Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the kofun [the mounded tombs]) to have been constructed approximately at the beginning of the fourth century.

This tumulus is estimated from the excavated Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the kofun [the mounded tombs]) to have been constructed approximately at the beginning of the fourth century.

sen.j: 少し古い巨大前方後円墳西殿塚古墳（234メートル）のすぐ東側に並列している。
sen.e: It is arranged parallel to Nishitonotsuka Tumulus (length: 234 m), a huge keyhole-shaped tomb mound, which is a bit older than Higashidonozuka Tumulus, right on the east side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/西殿塚古墳: 用語集には訳語が2つ登録されていますが、東殿塚古墳として登録されている訳語に合う訳語を採用しています。/巨大前方後円墳: 定訳不明
sen.e: It is arranged parallel to Nishitonotsuka-kofun Tumulus (length: 234 meters), a huge keyhole-shaped mound, which is a bit older than Higashidonozuka-kofun Tumulus, right on the east side.
It is arranged parallel to Nishitonotsuka-kofun Tumulus (length: 234 meters), a huge keyhole-shaped mound, which is a bit older than Higashidonozuka-kofun Tumulus, right on the east side.

sen.j: 両古墳は傾斜地に立地している。
sen.e: Both tumuli are located on an inclined plane.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Both tumuli are located on an inclined plane.
Both tumuli are located on an inclined plane.

sen.j: 主軸を南北に取っている。
sen.e: The principal axis is oriented north and south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The principal axis is oriented north and south.
The principal axis is oriented north and south.

sen.j: 標高約140メートルの高所に位置している。
sen.e: They are located on a high place, which is approximately 140 meters above sea level.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are located on a high place, which is approximately 140 meters above sea level.
They are located on a high place, which is approximately 140 meters above sea level.

sen.j: 墳丘に上がると奈良盆地の全域を見渡すことができる。
sen.e: If we climb the tumulus, we can look out over the whole area of Nara Basin.
The whole area of Nara Basin can be looked down from the top of the tumulus.
The whole area of Nara Basin can be looked down from the top of the tumulus.

sen.j: 墳丘長139メートルで、後円部は主軸に対してやや楕円になり、前方部は長い。
sen.e: The length of the tumulus is 139 m, and the form of the rounded part is rather oval toward the principal axis, and the front part is long.
The length of the tumulus is 139 meters, and the form of the back circular part is rather oval toward the principal axis, and the front square part is long.
The length of the tumulus is 139 meters, and the form of the back circular part is rather oval toward the principal axis, and the front square part is long.

sen.j: 後円部と前方部の比は、1:1.5である。
sen.e: The ratio of the length of the rounded part to that of the front part is 1 to 1.5.
sen.cmt: 原文で「11.5」となっていた箇所をWebで確認すると「1:1.5」でしたので、原文を訂正しました。
sen.e: The ratio of the length of the back circular part to that of the front square part is 1 to 1.5.
The ratio of the length of the back circular part to that of the front square part is 1 to 1.5.

sen.j: 主軸は南北であり、東西の側面に高低差が出来ている。
sen.e: The principal axis is oriented north and south, and there is a difference in height between the east and west sides.
The principal axis is oriented north and south, and there is a difference in height between the east and west sides.
The principal axis is oriented north and south, and there is a difference in height between the east and west sides.

sen.j: 後円部の頂上は荒らされており、不定形である。
sen.e: The top of the rounded part is ruined, and it has no particular form.
The top of the back circular part is ruined, and it has no particular form.
The top of the back circular part is ruined, and it has no particular form.

sen.j: 前方部はくびれ部分付近が平坦で端部で台形状に高くなっている。
sen.e: The narrow section of the front part is flat, and the level of the end is heightened in a trapezoidal shape.
sen.cmt: くびれ部分: 定訳不明
sen.e: The narrow section of the front square part is flat, and the level of the end is heightened in a trapezoidal shape.
The narrow section of the front square part is flat, and the level of the end is heightened in a trapezoidal shape.

sen.j: そこに二列の埴輪列と列石が認められた。
sen.e: It was confirmed that Haniwa were arranged in two rows and stones were lined up there.
sen.cmt: 二列: この語句が「埴輪列」だけに係るのか、それとも「埴輪列」「列石」の両者に係るのか判断が困難ですが、両者に係るという確証はないため、「埴輪列」のみに係るものとして訳しました。/埴輪列、列石: 定訳不明
sen.e: It was confirmed that Haniwa were arranged in two rows and stones were lined up there.
It was confirmed that Haniwa were arranged in two rows and stones were lined up there.

sen.j: 墳丘上部の斜面では墳丘を取り巻く円筒埴輪が並べられていたものと想像される。
sen.e: It is presumed that Ento Haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) were arranged circularly around the tumulus on a slope at the upper part of the tumulus.
It is presumed that cylindrical Haniwa were arranged circularly around the tumulus on a slope at the upper part of the tumulus.
It is presumed that cylindrical Haniwa were arranged circularly around the tumulus on a slope at the upper part of the tumulus.

tit.j: 出土品埴輪の船画など
tit.e: Boat drawings made on the excavated Haniwa, etc.
Boat drawings made on the excavated Haniwa, and so on
Boat drawings made on the excavated Haniwa, and so on

sen.j: 発掘調査で前方部西側の一角から造り出し的な祭祀遺構が見つかった。
sen.e: Ancient structural remnants used for religious services, which resemble narrow terraces, were found in a corner on the west side of the front part by excavation and research.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/祭祀遺構: 定訳不明
sen.e: Ancient structural remnants used for religious services, which resemble narrow terraces, were found in a corner on the west side of the front square part by excavations and researches.
Ancient structural remnants used for religious services, which resemble narrow terraces, were found in a corner on the west side of the front square part by excavations and researches.

sen.j: そこから多量の埴輪片が出土した。
sen.e: A lot of debris of Haniwa were excavated there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/埴輪片: 定訳不明
sen.e: A lot of debris of Haniwa was excavated there.
A lot of debris of Haniwa was excavated there.

sen.j: 高さ約64センチ、最大口径約50センチの楕円形円筒埴輪が復元された。
sen.e: An elliptical Ento Haniwa was restored, which is approximately 64 cm in height and approximately 50 cm in maximum diameter.
sen.cmt: 最大口径、楕円形円筒埴輪: 定訳不明
sen.e: An elliptical cylindrical Haniwa was restored, which is approximately 64 centimeters in height and approximately 50 centimeters in maximum diameter.
An elliptical cylindrical Haniwa was restored, which is approximately 64 centimeters in height and approximately 50 centimeters in maximum diameter.

sen.j: その埴輪の下部にヘラ書き船の絵を描いたものが3点発見された。
sen.e: Three boat drawings engraved with a spatula-like tool were found on the lower part of the restored Haniwa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/ヘラ書き: 定訳は不明ですが、サイト「http://www.city.onojo.fukuoka.jp/edu/kyoiku/rekishi/shitei/hera.html」の記述から、「ヘラのような工具で刻まれた」という意味と推測されるため、その意味で訳しています。
sen.e: Three boat drawings engraved with a spatula-like tool were found on the lower part of the restored Haniwa.
Three boat drawings engraved with a spatula-like tool were found on the lower part of the restored Haniwa.

sen.j: 1～3号船画と名付けられた。
sen.e: They were named Boat Drawings Nos. 1 to 3.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were named Boat Drawings Nos. 1 to 3.
They were named Boat Drawings Nos. 1 to 3.

sen.j: もっとも詳細に描かれているのは1号船画である。
sen.e: The Boat Drawing No. 1 is the most detailed one.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Boat Drawing No. 1 is the most detailed one.
The Boat Drawing No. 1 is the most detailed one.

sen.j: 船はゴンドラの形をしている。
sen.e: The drawn boat has the same style as a gondola.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The drawn boat has the same style as a gondola.
The drawn boat has the same style as a gondola.

sen.j: 7本の櫂を描いている。
sen.e: Seven paddles are drawn there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Seven paddles are drawn there.
Seven paddles are drawn there.

sen.j: (この)ことから14人で漕ぐ大型船であり、帆に風を受けて海上を疾走する船を描いたものと解釈されている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is interpreted as a drawing depicting a large boat rowed by 14 men sailing with the wind on the sea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(分割で不完全な文になったため、文頭のカッコ内に「この」を補足しました)
sen.e: Therefore, it is interpreted as a drawing depicting a large boat rowed by 14 men sailing with the wind on the sea.
Therefore, it is interpreted as a drawing depicting a large boat rowed by 14 men sailing with the wind on the sea.

sen.j: 前方部西側の台形張り出し部から朝顔型埴輪・円筒埴輪・楕円形円筒埴輪や土器などが出土している。
sen.e: Haniwa in the shape of a broad-rimmed vase, Ento Haniwa, elliptical Ento Haniwa, earthenware, etc. were excavated at the edge of the trapezoid on the west side of the front part.
sen.cmt: 張り出し部: 定訳不明/朝顔型埴輪: 用語集に登録されている訳語を、本文の「埴輪」の訳語に合わせて修正しています。/土器: 用語集に「earthware」と登録されていますが、「earthenware」です。
sen.e: Haniwa in the shape of a broad-rimmed vase, cylindrical Haniwa, elliptical cylindrical Haniwa, earthenware, and so on, were excavated at the edge of the trapezoid on the west side of the front square part.

Haniwa in the shape of a broad-rimmed vase, cylindrical Haniwa, elliptical cylindrical Haniwa, earthenware, and so on, were excavated at the edge of the trapezoid on the west side of the front square part.

sen.j: 円筒埴輪にはヒレ付きのものもみられる。
sen.e: Some Ento Haniwa have fins, too
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/ヒレ: 定訳不明
sen.e: Some cylindrical Haniwa have fins, too
Some cylindrical Haniwa have fins, too

sen.j: 格段にヒレがみられる。
sen.e: Each section has a fin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/格段: 正しくは「各段」と思われますので、その意味で訳しています。
sen.e: Each section has a fin.
Each section has a fin.

sen.j: 円筒に巴形・正方形・長方形・円形の透かしが施されている。
sen.e: Openwork of a comma-shaped heraldic design or in the shape of a square, a rectangle, or a circle is carved on its cylinder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Openworks of a comma-shaped heraldic design or in the shape of a square, a rectangle, or a circle are carved on its cylinder.
Openworks of a comma-shaped heraldic design or in the shape of a square, a rectangle, or a circle are carved on its cylinder.

sen.j: 土器には、砕かれた土器や形を保っている供献土器がたくさんある。
sen.e: The excavated pieces of earthenware include not only a lot of broken pieces, but also many pieces that were used to make an offering to a tomb, an altar, etc., and still remain intact.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/供献土器: 定訳は不明ですが、サイト「http://www.mitaka-iseki.jp/tokubetsu3/shitei03.htm」の説明を基に訳出しています。
sen.e: The excavated pieces of earthenware include not only a lot of broken pieces, but also many pieces that were used to make an offering to a tomb, an altar, and so on, and still remain intact.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: The excavated pieces of earthenware include not only a lot of broken pieces, but also many pieces that were used to make an offering to a tomb, an altar, and so on, and still remain intact.

sen.j: 山陰系・近江系・東海系などの他地域の土器が含まれている。
sen.e: They also include pieces made in other regions such as Sanin, Omi and Tokai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/山陰系・近江系・東海系: 定訳不明
sen.e: They also include earthenwares made in other regions such as Sanin, Omi and Tokai.
They also include earthenwares made in other regions such as Sanin, Omi and Tokai.

sen.j: 最古式と推定されている。
sen.e: They are estimated to be the oldest form in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/最古式: 定訳不明
sen.e: They are estimated to be the oldest form in Japan.
They are estimated to be the oldest form in Japan.
